Coincidentally, I was re-installing Rome 2 today, and my download was super slow. No joke, so its a crazy coincidence I can assist here.

Go into your steam settings, into "downloads" and try changing your download region. 

I am located in the bottom half of Wisconsin, right on the Mississippi. When I switched my region from Minneapolis to Chicago my download went from ~1MB/s to upwards of 8MB/s.

Cant say it will work for everyone, but apparently some steam servers are under higher demand than others.

I am in love with this sale.

List of acquisitions so far. The state of my wallet my force me to end before the end of the sale:

Portal

Portal 2

Sir, You Are Being Hunted

Bully: Scholarship Edition

Pixel Piracy

Eron

Mafia 2

Prison Architect

Cities: Skylines

So far I've only played Portal and Prison Architect. Prison Architect is great fun, I've had a lot of fun overcrowding the prison and removing any sort of security measures keeping them in. 

I actually finished Portal in one go, I couldn't stop playing it, and it's the first game that made me sad that it ended. At the end, I'd already heard "Still Alive" many times, but it's completely different seeing it in a youtube video vs. struggling through the entire game and seeing it in High-Def fullscreen glory at the end. Though, the whole XXXX thing was giving me the creeps the first couple times I saw it. The YYYY was also difficult and at times creepy. The story was fan-effing-tastic, to see the slow reveal of ZZZZ was subtle, yet interesting. I can honestly say that I understand all the fuss that was made a few years ago about it, its probably the best game I've ever played.
